summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 24, 2019, discussing an incident where Jeffrey Epstein was found unconscious in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) with marks on his neck. The email notes his cellmate was Nick Tartaglione, a former police officer charged with a quadruple homicide, and mentions the Washington Post has inquired about the incident.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Found unconscious in his cell at MCC with red marks on his neck; revived but could not recall what happened.

persons.name: Nick Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate at MCC who denied knowledge of the incident; described as a former police officer and subject of a quadruple homicide case approved for the death penalty.

connections.description: Were sharing a cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center when Epstein was found unconscious.

events.title: Epstein found unconscious in cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unconscious in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center with red marks on his neck. He was revived by staff but could not recall what happened. His cellmate denied any knowledge.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unconscious in his cell at MCC with red marks on his neck on or about July 23, 2019.
Epstein's cellmate was Nick Tartaglione, a former police officer charged with a quadruple homicide and approved for the death penalty.
The MCC initiated an investigation into the incident per standard operating procedures.
The Washington Post had made an inquiry about the incident, indicating media attention.
Epstein was medically evaluated and removed from the cell after the incident.
